result.arabic_text: وَٱلذَّٰرِيَٰتِ ذَرۡوٗا
result.translation: By the winds that scatter [dust],

result.arabic_text: فَٱلۡحَٰمِلَٰتِ وِقۡرٗا
result.translation: and by the clouds carrying loads of water,

result.arabic_text: فَٱلۡجَٰرِيَٰتِ يُسۡرٗا
result.translation: and by the ships that sail with ease,

result.arabic_text: فَٱلۡمُقَسِّمَٰتِ أَمۡرًا
result.translation: and by the angels who distribute [blessings] by His command.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٞ
result.translation: Indeed, what you are promised is true,

result.arabic_text: وَإِنَّ ٱلدِّينَ لَوَٰقِعٞ
result.translation: and the Judgment will surely come to pass.

result.arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡحُبُكِ
result.translation: By the heaven with its pathways[1],

result.arabic_text: إِنَّكُمۡ لَفِي قَوۡلٖ مُّخۡتَلِفٖ
result.translation: Indeed, you [Makkans] have conflicting views[2].
result.footnotes: [2] Concerning the Prophet (ﷺ) and the Qur’an.

result.arabic_text: يُؤۡفَكُ عَنۡهُ مَنۡ أُفِكَ
result.translation: He who is diverted from it is destined to be diverted.

result.arabic_text: قُتِلَ ٱلۡخَرَّٰصُونَ
result.translation: Doomed[3] are those who base their beliefs on conjecture.

result.arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي غَمۡرَةٖ سَاهُونَ
result.translation: those who are steeped in ignorance heedlessly.

result.arabic_text: يَسۡـَٔلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ
result.translation: They ask [mockingly], “When is the Day of Judgment?”

result.arabic_text: يَوۡمَ هُمۡ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ يُفۡتَنُونَ
result.translation: It is the Day when they will be punished by the Fire.

result.arabic_text: ذُوقُواْ فِتۡنَتَكُمۡ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسۡتَعۡجِلُونَ
result.translation: [It will be said], “Taste your punishment! This is what you were seeking to hasten.”

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٍ
result.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and springs,

result.arabic_text: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَبۡلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحۡسِنِينَ
result.translation: receiving what their Lord will give them, for they were indeed doers of good beforehand.

result.arabic_text: كَانُواْ قَلِيلٗا مِّنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ مَا يَهۡجَعُونَ
result.translation: They used to sleep only a little at night[4],
result.footnotes: [4] i.e., spending most of the night in prayer, reciting the Qur’an, and in supplication.

result.arabic_text: وَبِٱلۡأَسۡحَارِ هُمۡ يَسۡتَغۡفِرُونَ
result.translation: and before dawn they would seek forgiveness[5],
result.footnotes: [5] Supererogatory prayers and supplications are recommended before dawn.

result.arabic_text: وَفِيٓ أَمۡوَٰلِهِمۡ حَقّٞ لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلۡمَحۡرُومِ
result.translation: and in their wealth, there was a share for the beggar and the destitute.

result.arabic_text: وَفِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ءَايَٰتٞ لِّلۡمُوقِنِينَ
result.translation: On earth there are signs for those who are certain in faith,

result.arabic_text: وَفِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡۚ أَفَلَا تُبۡصِرُونَ
result.translation: and also within yourselves. Do you not see?

result.arabic_text: وَفِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ رِزۡقُكُمۡ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
result.translation: And in the heaven is your provision and all that you are promised.

result.arabic_text: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقّٞ مِّثۡلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمۡ تَنطِقُونَ
result.translation: By the Lord of the heaven and earth, this [resurrection] is certainly as true as the fact that you can speak.

result.arabic_text: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيۡفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ ٱلۡمُكۡرَمِينَ
result.translation: Has there come to you the story of Abraham’s honored guests[6]?

result.arabic_text: إِذۡ دَخَلُواْ عَلَيۡهِ فَقَالُواْ سَلَٰمٗاۖ قَالَ سَلَٰمٞ قَوۡمٞ مُّنكَرُونَ
result.translation: When they came to him and said, “Peace.” He said, “Upon you be peace.” [saying to himself] “Unknown people!”

result.arabic_text: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ فَجَآءَ بِعِجۡلٖ سَمِينٖ
result.translation: Then he went quickly to his household, and came with a fat [roasted] calf,

result.arabic_text: فَقَرَّبَهُۥٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡ قَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
result.translation: and placed it before them and said, “Will you not eat?”

result.arabic_text: فَأَوۡجَسَ مِنۡهُمۡ خِيفَةٗۖ قَالُواْ لَا تَخَفۡۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَٰمٍ عَلِيمٖ
result.translation: He felt apprehensive about them[7]. They said, “Do not be afraid,” and gave him glad tidings of a knowledgeable son.
result.footnotes: [7] In their culture, if a guest refused to eat the food provided, it was considered a sign of ill will. See footnote 11:70.

result.arabic_text: فَأَقۡبَلَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ فِي صَرَّةٖ فَصَكَّتۡ وَجۡهَهَا وَقَالَتۡ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٞ
result.translation: His wife cried out loud, and struck her face [in astonishment] and said, “[I am] a barren old woman!”

result.arabic_text: قَالُواْ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
result.translation: They said, “This is what your Lord said. Indeed, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing.”

result.arabic_text: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطۡبُكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ
result.translation: Abraham said, “Then what is your mission, O messengers?”

result.arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّآ أُرۡسِلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوۡمٖ مُّجۡرِمِينَ
result.translation: They said, “We have been sent to a wicked people,

result.arabic_text: لِنُرۡسِلَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حِجَارَةٗ مِّن طِينٖ
result.translation: to send down upon them stones of clay,

result.arabic_text: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلۡمُسۡرِفِينَ
result.translation: marked by your Lord for the transgressors.”

result.arabic_text: فَأَخۡرَجۡنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: We brought out those believers who were there,

result.arabic_text: فَمَا وَجَدۡنَا فِيهَا غَيۡرَ بَيۡتٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡمُسۡلِمِينَ
result.translation: but We only found in it one Muslim household[8].

result.arabic_text: وَتَرَكۡنَا فِيهَآ ءَايَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
result.translation: And We left there a sign[9] for those who fear the painful punishment.
result.footnotes: [9] i.e., the ruins of Sodom or the Dead Sea in Palestine, as a lesson for people.

result.arabic_text: وَفِي مُوسَىٰٓ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٖ
result.translation: And [there is a sign in the story of] Moses when We sent him to Pharaoh with compelling proofs,

result.arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكۡنِهِۦ وَقَالَ سَٰحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٞ
result.translation: But he and his supporters turned away, and he said about [Moses], “A magician or a madman!”

result.arabic_text: فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ وَجُنُودَهُۥ فَنَبَذۡنَٰهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٞ
result.translation: So We seized him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea while he was blameworthy[10].

result.arabic_text: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلرِّيحَ ٱلۡعَقِيمَ
result.translation: And [there is a sign in the story of] ‘Ād, when We sent against them the devastating barren wind[11].
result.footnotes: [11] Devoid of all goodness such as carrying rain or fertilizing trees.

result.arabic_text: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيۡءٍ أَتَتۡ عَلَيۡهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتۡهُ كَٱلرَّمِيمِ
result.translation: It spared nothing it came upon except that it reduced it to ruin and decay.

result.arabic_text: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذۡ قِيلَ لَهُمۡ تَمَتَّعُواْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ
result.translation: And [there is a sign in the story of] Thamūd, when they were told, “Enjoy yourselves for a while[12].”

result.arabic_text: فَعَتَوۡاْ عَنۡ أَمۡرِ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّٰعِقَةُ وَهُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ
result.translation: But they rebelled against the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them, while they were looking on.

result.arabic_text: فَمَا ٱسۡتَطَٰعُواْ مِن قِيَامٖ وَمَا كَانُواْ مُنتَصِرِينَ
result.translation: They could not withstand it, nor could they ward it off.

result.arabic_text: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَوۡمٗا فَٰسِقِينَ
result.translation: And the people of Noah [were also destroyed] before them. They were indeed a rebellious people.

result.arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بَنَيۡنَٰهَا بِأَيۡيْدٖ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
result.translation: We built the heaven with might[13], and We are indeed expanding it.
result.footnotes: [13] ’Ayd does not mean "hands" here. This is not from the verses of Allah's attributes, for Allah Almighty did not add it to Himself, i.e., He did not say, "My ’ayd, or Our ’ayd".

result.arabic_text: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فَرَشۡنَٰهَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡمَٰهِدُونَ
result.translation: And We spread out the earth. How well did We smooth it out[14]!
result.footnotes: [14] The earth was spread out to accommodate the creatures. Its spherical shape is mentioned in 39:5.

result.arabic_text: وَمِن كُلِّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَا زَوۡجَيۡنِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَذَكَّرُونَ
result.translation: And We have created everything in pairs[15], so that you may take heed.
result.footnotes: [15] Such as day and night, male and female, light and darkness, sweet and bitter, hot and cold, etc.

result.arabic_text: فَفِرُّوٓاْ إِلَى ٱللَّهِۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
result.translation: So flee to Allah[16]. Indeed, I am a clear warner to you from Him.
result.footnotes: [16] From His punishment to His reward by shunning disbelief and sin and by obeying Him.

result.arabic_text: وَلَا تَجۡعَلُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
result.translation: And do not set up another god with Allah. Indeed, I am a clear warner to you from Him.”

result.arabic_text: كَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَتَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُواْ سَاحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٌ
result.translation: Likewise, no messenger came to those before them without being told: “A magician, or a madman!”

result.arabic_text: أَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِهِۦۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ
result.translation: Did they suggest this to one another[17]? Rather they are transgressing people.
result.footnotes: [17] i.e., Did the previous disbelievers pass on these false allegations to the pagans of Makkah so they repeat their words?

result.arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِمَلُومٖ
result.translation: So turn away from them [O Prophet], for you are not to blame[18].
result.footnotes: [18] After you have delivered the message.

result.arabic_text: وَذَكِّرۡ فَإِنَّ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ تَنفَعُ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: But keep reminding them, for reminder benefits the believers.

result.arabic_text: وَمَا خَلَقۡتُ ٱلۡجِنَّ وَٱلۡإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعۡبُدُونِ
result.translation: I have not created the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.

result.arabic_text: مَآ أُرِيدُ مِنۡهُم مِّن رِّزۡقٖ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَن يُطۡعِمُونِ
result.translation: I seek no provision from them, nor do I want them to feed Me.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلرَّزَّاقُ ذُو ٱلۡقُوَّةِ ٱلۡمَتِينُ
result.translation: Indeed, it is Allah Who is the All-Provider[19], Lord of Power, the Mighty.
result.footnotes: [19] He Provides His creatures with everything they need. Among His provisions is guidance.

result.arabic_text: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ ذَنُوبٗا مِّثۡلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصۡحَٰبِهِمۡ فَلَا يَسۡتَعۡجِلُونِ
result.translation: Indeed, those who do wrong will have a share [of punishment] like that of their predecessors, so let them not ask Me to hasten it.

result.arabic_text: فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِن يَوۡمِهِمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
result.translation: So woe to those who disbelieve from [the punishment of] the Day which they are promised.
